Contains all caching-related interfaces and exceptions utilized by the framework for performance-enhancing caching during runtime.

In good interface-driven design fashion, JSecurity uses the Cache and CacheProvider interfaces to separate implementation details from framework components. A CacheProvider is responsible for creating and managing Caches. A Cache is, as its name implies, a key-value based data map.

Common underlying CacheProvider and Cache implementations support anything from simple map-based memory caches to Ehcache to distributed network caches like JBoss cache.
